titles.title: A bill to restore Federal services to the Pokagon Band of Potawatomi Indians.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6857-6858)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 103-543.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Inouye without amendment. With written report No. 103-266.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 434.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Late Referral to the Subcommittee on Native American Affairs (Aug 30, 94).
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-620.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 339.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 502 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of S. 1066 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
Rule H. Res. 502 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 502.

Rule provides for consideration of S. 1066 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered except motion to recommit. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 502 and Rule XXIII.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Robert Menendez to act as Chairman of the Committee.
GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report S. 1066.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 174 (Roll no. 373).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/10/1994--Passed Senate amended. Affirms Federal recognition of, and makes eligible for Federal services, the Pokagon Band of Potawatomi Indians. States that the Band's service area shall consist of specified counties in Michigan and Indiana.
